title: Create Relative risk column — create_rel_risk_transformator
text: dataname (character(1)) name dataset columns used possible transformation. dataname passed quotes ex: "ADSL". column_name (character(1)) field variable dataset. control_group (character(1)) one existing level selected column_name. label_name (character(1)) label new field variable.

title: Create Relative risk column — create_rel_risk_transformator
code: app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(IRIS = iris, code = "IRIS <- iris"),   modules = teal::modules(     teal::example_module(       transformators = list(create_rel_risk_transformator("IRIS"))     )   ) ) if (interactive()) {   shiny::shinyApp(app$ui, app$server) }

title: Change X-axis scaling decorator for teal.modules.clinical::tm_g_forest_rsp. — forestplot_x_decorator
code: data <- teal_data() #> Error in teal_data(): could not find function "teal_data" data <- within(data, {   ADSL <- tmc_ex_adsl   ADRS <- tmc_ex_adrs %>%     dplyr::mutate(AVALC = tern::d_onco_rsp_label(AVALC) %>%       dplyr::with_label("Character Result/Finding")) %>%     dplyr::filter(PARAMCD != "OVRINV" | AVISIT == "FOLLOW UP") }) #> Error in UseMethod("within"): no applicable method for 'within' applied to an object of class "function" join_keys(data) <- default_cdisc_join_keys[names(data)] #> Error: object 'default_cdisc_join_keys' not found  ADSL <- data[["ADSL"]] #> Error in data[["ADSL"]]: object of type 'closure' is not subsettable ADRS <- data[["ADRS"]] #> Error in data[["ADRS"]]: object of type 'closure' is not subsettable  arm_ref_comp <- list(   ARM = list(     ref = "B: Placebo",     comp = c("A: Drug X", "C: Combination")   ),   ARMCD = list(     ref = "ARM B",     comp = c("ARM A", "ARM C")   ) )  app <- teal::init(   data = data,   modules = teal::modules(     teal.modules.clinical::tm_g_forest_rsp(       label = "Forest Response",       dataname = "ADRS",       arm_var = choices_selected(         variable_choices(ADSL, c("ARM", "ARMCD")),         "ARMCD"       ),       arm_ref_comp = arm_ref_comp,       paramcd = choices_selected(         value_choices(ADRS, "PARAMCD", "PARAM"),         "INVET"       ),       subgroup_var = choices_selected(         variable_choices(ADSL, names(ADSL)),         c("BMRKR2", "SEX")       ),       strata_var = choices_selected(         variable_choices(ADSL, c("STRATA1", "STRATA2")),         "STRATA2"       ),       plot_height = c(600L, 200L, 2000L),       decorators = list(         plot = forestplot_x_decorator()       ),       default_responses = list(         BESRSPI = list(           rsp = c("Stable Disease (SD)", "Not Evaluable (NE)"),           levels = c(             "Complete Response (CR)", "Partial Response (PR)", "Stable Disease (SD)",             "Progressive Disease (PD)", "Not Evaluable (NE)"           )         ),         INVET = list(           rsp = c("Complete Response (CR)", "Partial Response (PR)"),           levels = c(             "Complete Response (CR)", "Not Evaluable (NE)", "Partial Response (PR)",             "Progressive Disease (PD)", "Stable Disease (SD)"           )         ),         OVRINV = list(           rsp = c("Progressive Disease (PD)", "Stable Disease (SD)"),           levels = c("Progressive Disease (PD)", "Stable Disease (SD)", "Not Evaluable (NE)")         )       )     )   ) ) #> Error in teal::init(data = data, modules = teal::modules(teal.modules.clinical::tm_g_forest_rsp(label = "Forest Response",     dataname = "ADRS", arm_var = choices_selected(variable_choices(ADSL,         c("ARM", "ARMCD")), "ARMCD"), arm_ref_comp = arm_ref_comp,     paramcd = choices_selected(value_choices(ADRS, "PARAMCD",         "PARAM"), "INVET"), subgroup_var = choices_selected(variable_choices(ADSL,         names(ADSL)), c("BMRKR2", "SEX")), strata_var = choices_selected(variable_choices(ADSL,         c("STRATA1", "STRATA2")), "STRATA2"), plot_height = c(600L,         200L, 2000L), decorators = list(plot = forestplot_x_decorator()),     default_responses = list(BESRSPI = list(rsp = c("Stable Disease (SD)",         "Not Evaluable (NE)"), levels = c("Complete Response (CR)",         "Partial Response (PR)", "Stable Disease (SD)", "Progressive Disease (PD)",         "Not Evaluable (NE)")), INVET = list(rsp = c("Complete Response (CR)",         "Partial Response (PR)"), levels = c("Complete Response (CR)",         "Not Evaluable (NE)", "Partial Response (PR)", "Progressive Disease (PD)",         "Stable Disease (SD)")), OVRINV = list(rsp = c("Progressive Disease (PD)",         "Stable Disease (SD)"), levels = c("Progressive Disease (PD)",         "Stable Disease (SD)", "Not Evaluable (NE)")))))): Assertion on 'data' failed: Must inherit from class 'teal_data'/'teal_data_module', but has class 'function'. if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(app$ui, app$server) }

what: Create a forest plot from an rtable with x transform settings — g_forest_with_transform
title: Create a forest plot from an rtable with x transform settings — g_forest_with_transform
text: Given rtables::rtable() object least one column single value one column 2 values, converts table ggplot2::ggplot() object generates accompanying forest plot. table forest plot printed side--side.

title: Create a forest plot from an rtable with x transform settings — g_forest_with_transform
code: g_forest_with_transform(   tbl,   col_x = attr(tbl, "col_x"),   col_ci = attr(tbl, "col_ci"),   vline = 1,   forest_header = attr(tbl, "forest_header"),   xlim = c(0.1, 10),   transform_x = NA,   x_at = c(0.1, 1, 10),   width_columns = NULL,   lbl_col_padding = 0,   rel_width_forest = 0.25,   font_size = 12,   col_symbol_size = attr(tbl, "col_symbol_size"),   col = getOption("ggplot2.discrete.colour")[1],   ggtheme = NULL,   as_list = FALSE )

title: Create a forest plot from an rtable with x transform settings — g_forest_with_transform
text: tbl (VTableTree)rtables table least one column single value one column 2 values. col_x (integer(1) NULL) column index estimator. default tries get tbl attribute col_x, otherwise needs manually specified. NULL, points excluded forest plot. col_ci (integer(1) NULL) column index confidence intervals. default tries get tbl attribute col_ci, otherwise needs manually specified. NULL, lines excluded forest plot. vline (numeric) position vertical reference line plot. like 0 1 forest plot. forest_header (character(2)) text displayed left right vline, respectively. vline = NULL forest_header printed. default tries get tbl attribute forest_header. NULL, defaults extracted table possible, set "Comparison\nBetter" "Treatment\nBetter" . xlim (numeric) range x-axis limits. Example: c(0.1, 10) transform_x (character) function x-values transformation x_at (numeric) specifies tick marks axis. value union(xlim, vline) Example: c(0.1,1,10). width_columns (numeric) vector column widths. element's position colwidths corresponds column tbl position. NULL, column widths calculated according maximum number characters per column. lbl_col_padding (numeric) padding label columns value. Default 0. rel_width_forest (proportion) proportion total width allocate forest plot. Relative width table 1 - rel_width_forest. as_list = TRUE, parameter ignored. font_size (numeric(1)) font size. col_symbol_size (numeric NULL) column index tbl containing data used determine relative size estimator plot symbol. Typically, symbol size proportional sample size used calculate estimator. NULL, symbol size used subgroups. default tries get tbl attribute col_symbol_size, otherwise needs manually specified. col (character) color(s). ggtheme (theme) graphical theme provided ggplot2 control styling plot. as_list (flag) whether two ggplot objects returned list. TRUE, named list two elements, table plot, returned. FALSE (default) table forest plot printed side--side via cowplot::plot_grid().

title: Create a forest plot from an rtable with x transform settings — g_forest_with_transform
text: ggplot forest plot table.

title: Create a forest plot from an rtable with x transform settings — g_forest_with_transform
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(forcats)  adrs <- tern_ex_adrs #> Error: object 'tern_ex_adrs' not found n_records <- 20 adrs_labels <- formatters::var_labels(adrs, fill = TRUE) #> Error: object 'adrs' not found adrs <- adrs %>%   filter(PARAMCD == "BESRSPI") %>%   filter(ARM %in% c("A: Drug X", "B: Placebo")) %>%   slice(seq_len(n_records)) %>%   droplevels() %>%   mutate(     # Reorder levels of factor to make the placebo group the reference arm.     ARM = fct_relevel(ARM, "B: Placebo"),     rsp = AVALC == "CR"   ) #> Error: object 'adrs' not found formatters::var_labels(adrs) <- c(adrs_labels, "Response") #> Error: object 'adrs_labels' not found df <- extract_rsp_subgroups(   variables = list(rsp = "rsp", arm = "ARM", subgroups = c("SEX", "STRATA2")),   data = adrs ) #> Error in extract_rsp_subgroups(variables = list(rsp = "rsp", arm = "ARM",     subgroups = c("SEX", "STRATA2")), data = adrs): could not find function "extract_rsp_subgroups" # Full commonly used response table.  tbl <- basic_table() %>%   tabulate_rsp_subgroups(df) #> Error in tabulate_rsp_subgroups(., df): could not find function "tabulate_rsp_subgroups" g_forest_with_transform(tbl) #> Error in g_forest_with_transform(tbl): Assertion on 'tbl' failed: Must inherit from class 'VTableTree', but has class 'function'.  # Odds ratio only table.  tbl_or <- basic_table() %>%   tabulate_rsp_subgroups(df, vars = c("n_tot", "or", "ci")) #> Error in tabulate_rsp_subgroups(., df, vars = c("n_tot", "or", "ci")): could not find function "tabulate_rsp_subgroups" g_forest_with_transform(   tbl_or,   forest_header = c("Comparison\nBetter", "Treatment\nBetter") ) #> Error: object 'tbl_or' not found  # Survival forest plot example. adtte <- tern_ex_adtte #> Error: object 'tern_ex_adtte' not found # Save variable labels before data processing steps. adtte_labels <- formatters::var_labels(adtte, fill = TRUE) #> Error: object 'adtte' not found adtte_f <- adtte %>%   filter(     PARAMCD == "OS",     ARM %in% c("B: Placebo", "A: Drug X"),     SEX %in% c("M", "F")   ) %>%   mutate(     # Reorder levels of ARM to display reference arm before treatment arm.     ARM = droplevels(fct_relevel(ARM, "B: Placebo")),     SEX = droplevels(SEX),     AVALU = as.character(AVALU),     is_event = CNSR == 0   ) #> Error: object 'adtte' not found labels <- list(   "ARM" = adtte_labels["ARM"],   "SEX" = adtte_labels["SEX"],   "AVALU" = adtte_labels["AVALU"],   "is_event" = "Event Flag" ) #> Error: object 'adtte_labels' not found formatters::var_labels(adtte_f)[names(labels)] <- as.character(labels) #> Error in as.character(labels): cannot coerce type 'closure' to vector of type 'character' df <- extract_survival_subgroups(   variables = list(     tte = "AVAL",     is_event = "is_event",     arm = "ARM", subgroups = c("SEX", "BMRKR2")   ),   data = adtte_f ) #> Error in extract_survival_subgroups(variables = list(tte = "AVAL", is_event = "is_event",     arm = "ARM", subgroups = c("SEX", "BMRKR2")), data = adtte_f): could not find function "extract_survival_subgroups" table_hr <- basic_table() %>%   tabulate_survival_subgroups(df, time_unit = adtte_f$AVALU[1]) #> Error in tabulate_survival_subgroups(., df, time_unit = adtte_f$AVALU[1]): could not find function "tabulate_survival_subgroups" g_forest_with_transform(table_hr) #> Error: object 'table_hr' not found

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: Decorator function update various settings ggplot plot objects

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
code: ggplot_decorator(   output_name,   label_text = "decorator",   render_ui = c(),   plot_options = list(title = "", footnote = "", y_breaks = "", y_limits_max = "",     y_limits_min = "", x_breaks = "", x_labels_discrete = "", x_labels_cont = "",     y_labels_discrete = "", y_labels_cont = "", font_size_geom_text = "",     font_size_plot_title = "", font_size_axis_title = "", font_size_axis_text = "") )

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: output_name name output plot object. label_text Customized label text decorator render_ui Vector ggplot_options following list: "title" - Title plot, "footnote" - Footnote plot, "y_breaks" - Value breaks(numeric) y-axis. Note: y_limits_max y_limits_min also provided, "y_limits_max" - Value y-axis maximum limit(numeric). Note: y_limits_max y_breaks also provided, "y_limits_min" - Value y-axis minimum limit(numeric). Note: y_breaks y_limits_min also provided, "x_breaks"- Value breaks continuous x-axis(numeric). Note: comma separated, "x_labels_discrete" - Values labels discrete x-axis. Note: comma separated, "x_labels_cont" - Values labels continuous x-axis. Note: comma separated, "y_labels_discrete" - Values labels discrete y-axis. Note: comma separated, "y_labels_cont" - Values labels continuous y-axis. Note: comma separated, "font_size_geom_text" - Font size geom_text. Note: numeric value provided, "font_size_plot_title"- Font size plot title text. Note: numeric value provided, "font_size_axis_title"- Font size axis title text. Note: numeric value provided, "font_size_axis_text"- Font size axis labels text. Note: numeric value provided plot_options Named list list values ggplot options. app developer can specify required list options calling decorator.

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: Returns modified plot object transformation applied.

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
text: module creates UI text controls specifying list ggplot options given plot_options param value. entered ggplot options applied ggplot plot object.

title: ggplot Decorator — ggplot_decorator
code: library(teal) #> Loading required package: shiny #> Loading required package: teal.data #> Loading required package: teal.code #> Loading required package: teal.slice #>  #> You are using teal version 1.0.0 #>  #> Attaching package: ‘teal’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:teal.slice’: #>  #>     as.teal_slices, teal_slices library(teal.modules.general) #> Loading required package: ggmosaic #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Loading required package: teal.transform app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(IRIS = iris, code = "IRIS <- iris"),   modules = teal::modules(     teal.modules.general::tm_g_scatterplot(       x = teal.transform::data_extract_spec(         dataname = "IRIS",         select = teal.transform::select_spec(choices = teal.transform::variable_choices(iris))       ),       y = teal.transform::data_extract_spec(         dataname = "IRIS",         select = teal.transform::select_spec(choices = teal.transform::variable_choices(iris))       ),       decorators = list(         plot = ggplot_decorator(           output_name = "plot", render_ui = c("title", "footnote", "font_size_axis_title")         )       )     )   ) ) #> Initializing tm_g_scatterplot if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(app$ui, app$server) }

what: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
text: transformator provides users flexible, dynamic filtering capabilities datasets. instance transformator operates single dataset. Users can define multiple filter blocks, : Conditions within block combined logical . Multiple blocks combined logical . allows creating complex filter expressions like: (Condition1 Condition2) (Condition3 Condition4) apply filtering across multiple datasets, users can instantiate multiple instances module, configured different dataset. module call independent manages filters specific dataset. Supported Data Types & Expressions: Supports filtering character, factor, numeric columns. Conditions can use operators: ==, !=, <, >, <=, >=. Conditions specified simple expressions, e.g., columnA == 'value' columnB != 5 columnC >= 10 block's conditions combined . Multiple blocks combined . Features: Add Multiple Blocks: Dynamically add new blocks alternative conditions. Add Conditions: Within block, add multiple conditions, duplicate prevention. Preview Filter Expression: Generate display current combined filter expression. Remove Conditions: Remove individual conditions within block. Expression Generation: resulting expression can directly used dplyr::filter() similar functions. Usage Pattern: Call module multiple times different dataset names filter multiple datasets independently. call manages filter state expression. Users can build complex filters per dataset apply combine needed.

title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
text: dataname (character(1)) Name dataset filter. Pass single dataset name string.

title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
text: teal::teal_transform_module

title: Apply Logical AND/OR filter transformations — or_filtering_transformator
code: app <- teal::init(   data = teal.data::teal_data(IRIS = iris),   modules = teal::modules(teal::example_module(     transformators = list(or_filtering_transformator("IRIS"))   )) ) if (interactive()) {   shinyApp(app$ui, app$server) }

title: Title and Footer Decorator — title_footer_decorator
text: function create UI component selecting title footer tables plots. reads title information specified Excel file allows users choose title provided options. also provides user flexibility customize title footer according specific needs.

title: Title and Footer Decorator — title_footer_decorator
text: output_name (character(1)) name output object (e.g., plot table). titles_file (character(1)) path Excel file containing title footer information. function expects titles first sheet named "Sheet1".

text: teal::teal_transform_module()

title: Title and Footer Decorator — title_footer_decorator
text: module creates UI dropdown selecting title. title selected, updates output either adding titles table modifying plot's title caption accordingly. Additionally, includes checkbox user can check enable customization, allowing enter values title footer designated input fields.
